text: of course <@U9GR3G88Y>!
<@UC46W9E77> just in terms of terminology, can we rename the cards channel to content? And lets just keep the original planned time for it
Yeah, that'd be great! Did you have a time in mind? Or would you like me to schedule it?
Cool, sounds good. So you'll take lead in this <@UC46W9E77>?

<@U9GR3G88Y> That works with me. If everyone could come with a few ideas to contribute to the overall theme, and then work on the structure of one card during the session, that'd be great. Then we can pool all of the ideas and schedule them. I'll post more about this in the card channel tomorrow :slightly_smiling_face:

<@UC46W9E77> about the testing session; since we are doing a temporarily feature freeze we could perhaps transform the testing session in a "content-session" in which everyone makes the weekly card. But again, that is up to you whether that fits in the strategy you are developing
if we assume the blog post is going up Tuesday, do you want the mailchimp email sent out today? or wednesday?

sorry <@UBE37B8JX>, I must have misunderstood it - when you said 'post one now and then another on Wednesday' i thought for some reason that was only in regards to the mailchimp... i see what you mean now

The Mailchimp was not made a priority after the discussion we had the last meeting... JH suggested a blog post should be published first and as soon as possible. We mentioned that the Mailchimp would be adjusted after the blog is released because it is a general rundown of our activities in the past months. That's why I suggested only publishing one atm and leaving the other for later <@UC46W9E77> perhaps I'm lost
in two stages?
<@UBE37B8JX> looking at MailChimp, I'm not sure it makes sense to send the email out in two stages otherwise people will inundated with information
are we doing another testing session?
<@U9GR3G88Y> if you could have one ready, that'd be ideal
<@UC46W9E77> did you already decide on the strategy regarding the cards? should I prepare one for Wednesday or not?
Okay, cool! See you tomorrow <@U0D6EPESC> - here's a link to the updated blog post by the way <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xFCDRB9PmVKPFWVWDBRog8azDjduX58zgp7b_STjqWk/edit>

text: <@UC46W9E77> no, I'll be back tomorrow
Are you in the office today <@U0D6EPESC>?
<@UBE37B8JX> Sounds like a good plan. <@U0D6EPESC>, of course, no problem! I'll apply Nat's changes and then link you the updated document in the drive!
<@UC46W9E77> I'd like to have a look at your revised blog post before we publish it. Is it okay to wait until tomorrow?
I think it would be good to post one now then another on Wednesday just incase it misses the eyes of a few

Hey <@UBE37B8JX>, I'm going to apply your changes to the blog post so it can be published at 4pm today. The MailChimp campaign is ready too. Did you want me to push that today, or wait until Wednesday to send it together?
Ah nice, thanks for the feedback <@UBE37B8JX>

I agree with Kelly, I thought the blog was more of an FYI + CTA for cards under the maker-movement [sensors] theme. I like your idea <@UC46W9E77> of showcasing something practical- you could ask <@U0D6EPESC> to bring an Arduino on Monday tinker and take photos to attach to the blog. My comments are on the doc-drive
although, i'm happy to wait until monday now and see what i can do to the blog post to focus on something practical we've done as maybe an example for the reader

Ah, perhaps I may have then misinterpreted it... Yeah, like you said I'd imagined it at a combination between suggestions and my own efforts, but I thought the sooner we send the blog post out and get the ball rolling the better

<@UC46W9E77> about the blog post; I interpreted the challenge to be yours, so I thought you would be the one to start implementing sensors at the office and write about your experiences and then ask others to make more suggestions. So more of a question from my side as to why you take this approach in the blog post?
Thanks a lot <@U9GR3G88Y>, I appreciate it - right aligned definitely fits better too
Yeah, I agree, that does look sharper!
<@UC46W9E77> also right aligned it to fit the avatar, what do you think?
<@UC46W9E77> not sure why but I couldn't open version one of the files you sent me. I think leaving out the christmas heat in the end anyway makes the visual a whole lot stronger..
Also, if anyone has any good photos of the office are you able to send them my way? I'll include this in the blog post and create a space on google drive for them for future use

Hey guys, here's a first draft of the blog post we discussed yesterday: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1oHNbAFmHZjtov0MQy64besk2SMSfUB1ZFtfewo7MFoE/edit> - <@UBE37B8JX> let me know what you think! <@U0D6EPESC> as a preliminary, i've included an amazon gift card as an incentive, though let me know if you disagree

text: <https://koneksa-mondo.nl/2018/12/05/publicspaces-beweging-tegen-commerciele-sociale-platforms/>

attachments.title: PublicSpaces: beweging tegen commerciële sociale platforms - Koneksa Mondo
attachments.text: Sinds dit voorjaar onderzoekt een coalitie van organisaties (van de Dutch Design Week tot VPRO en Wikimedia Netherlands) de mogelijkheden om het publieke domein in de online omgeving te versterken. Dit is volgens de betrokken organisaties nodig omdat de samenleving te afhankelijk is van commerciële sociale platforms als Facebook, Apple, Microsoft, Google en Amazon (FAMGA). De uitgangspunten en ontwikkelingen van de coalitie zijn te volgen via <http://PublicSpaces.net|PublicSpaces.net>, het platform van de gelijknamige, onafhankelijke stichting. Maandagavond na de boekpresentatie van The Platform Society (door José van Dijck, Thomas Poell en Martijn de Waal), schetste Geert-Jan Bogaerts, mede-initiatiefnemer en voorzitter van PublicSpaces, de stand van zaken.
attachments.fallback: Koneksa Mondo: PublicSpaces: beweging tegen commerciële sociale platforms - Koneksa Mondo

text: my mistake, have a card ready for next wednesday! (not this coming wednesday)

Hey guys, as I'm sure you're all aware, we're now using a focus theme for each month. This month's theme is sensors, and I've created the first card: 'Get Acquainted with Sensors.' (link: <https://offcourse.io/curator/jameshands/goal/get%20acquainted%20with%20sensors>) This is just a reminder that you each need to create a course card using the topic of sensors (if you're looking more generally, the maker movement) by Wednesday at 11:00 as this is when we'll have the next product test
<@UBE37B8JX> <https://www.pluralsightone.org/>

attachments.title: Pluralsight One
attachments.text: Pluralsight One is our commitment to drive significant, lasting social impact by improving equal access to technology skills and investing in catalytic solutions.
